text: Talk to the unfamiliar woman and find out about what's happening

title: Mission Description
content: As the daughter of theSupreme Guardian,Bronyahas always been quick and decisive — this pursuit operation targeted at you was no exception.Good thing your "good pal"Sampoarrived just in time to rescue you. It's just that... it would've been better if he didn't knock you out with the smoke bomb made from questionable ingredients.In your daze, you realize that you aren't tied up but placed on a bed somewhere — to a degree, this tells you that you're not in immediate danger. You'll have to ask the unfamiliar woman in front of you for more details.

line: How are you feeling? Any aches or pains?

children.line: Good. You were out for a while, I was beginning to worry. You were saying some strange things.

text: I've got migraines all over my body.

children.line: ...I hope you're joking, hehe... That's either an interesting metaphor, or you hit your head.
I bet, you were mumbling something about " Stellarons " and "wishes"... I couldn't make sense of it.

speaker: Natasha
line: Well, now that you're awake, you should probably try moving your limbs. I'm Natasha — a doctor in the underground. You've already spent a day in my clinic .

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Nice to meet you too... Hehe, you're very polite.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Yes... it's a place that's been sealed off and neglected by the overgrounders for more than a decade. The underground has none of the splendor of the surface — the people here dig tunnels and mine ore to make a living.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Mm-hmm, I'm afraid the conditions underground are terrible. People get sick easily here, and I'm the only doctor.

speaker: Natasha
line: Sampo's gone to clear up a mess of his own making, so I'm looking after you in the meantime. Based on your current state, I don't think there's any cause for alarm — you seem perfectly healthy.

speaker: Natasha
line: So if you don't mind, I'll go and take a look at the other patients?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Sampo just told me that you lost consciousness. He didn't say why. Still, I'll wager it had something to do with him — he's always tinkering with his devices.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Anyway, the opinion of the clinic is that none of you have come to harm.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Sampo told me. Don't worry, the Silvermane Guards won't follow you below ground. We've been cut off from the surface for many years. Even when things were at their worst down here, they never showed.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ...Of course, I don't know the whole story behind why the Architects ordered the lockdown. Who knows, thanks to you, they might finally be about to lift it... something that Wildfire 's wanted to achieve for a long time now.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Oh, please, you needn't worry. You've just been asleep for a while, I barely had to lift a finger.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: I... might've exaggerated your condition for Sampo's ears... but that guy owes me. He better bring me back some medicine.

speaker: Natasha
line: They've been up for a while already. The young guy with the dark hair left first — he went with Sampo.

speaker: Natasha
line: Your rowdier friend took off soon after waking up. I imagine she'll be taking a stroll nearby.

speaker: Natasha
line: As for the girl in the Silvermane Guard uniform, I told Sampo to watch her... but it seems that he left his post and she made a run for it.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Good question... he's a man of mystery. He claims to be a simple cross-border businessman — not that there's much to interest an Overworlder down here. Either way, he's got a surprising number of connections.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: I've managed to secure more than a few urgent medical supplies through him, and he's been a big help to Wildfire... In any case, I don't think his intentions are sinister.

text: I need to meet up with them.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Sure, but don't push yourself. If you start feeling unwell, come straight back and tell me.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ...And if you run into any trouble, you can try asking for Wildfire.

speaker: Natasha
line: It's a grassroots organization. Think of it as the Silvermane Guards of the underground, but less stone-hearted.

text: I can't thank you enough. Bye for now.

speaker: Natasha
line: No need to thank me. It's a doctor's duty to heal.

title: Step Description
content: The doctor named Natasha explained the entire incident to you. You now know two things:One, Dan Heng has been grabbed by Sampo. And two, March 7th abandoned you to go shopping. As for Bronya... Well, you're not too concerned about the well-being of your enemies right now.Whatever the case, you decide to find your two companions first and have a deep conversation about why they left you behind.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I gotta find March 7th and Dan Heng... but where should I start?)

speaker: Natasha
line: Y'know, the underground has been cut off from the surface for years. For you outsiders to descend on us out of nowhere is pretty incredible.

speaker: Natasha
line: Everything alright? You feeling okay?

text: I want to ask about the Underworld ...

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: The Underworld? What do you want to know?

children.text: Why do people live down here?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Because we need Geomarrow . After Belobog 's construction, the demand for energy kept increasing. The Eternal Freeze prevented us from expanding outwards, so our only choice was to go down.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: The people answered the call of the Architects and descended, excavating ore veins and establishing mines. Before we were sealed off, it was an honor to work underground.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: It was a choice... the pursuit of arduous labor for the survival of our entire civilization.

children.text: How is life in the Underworld?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ...It's never been good. Conditions are tough both above and below the surface. The Overworld is faced with the Eternal Freeze and Fragmentum corrosion, and the Underworld has to contend with hard labor, suffocating heat, and serious shortages.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: It's been over a decade since the Silvermane Guards withdrew from the Underworld, and the situation here has only gotten worse. The only contact we have is the exchange of Geomarrow for goods.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: And what's more... the Fragmentum corrosion has begun to reach us down here, too...

children.text: I want to ask something else.

text: I want to ask about Sampo...

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Ask away, but I'm afraid I don't know a lot about him myself.

children.text: How did you get to know him?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: A meticulously choreographed "chance meeting..." Sampo is pretty good at orchestrating unexpected encounters, and he always leaves a lasting impression.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: According to him, that's the gift of a businessman.

children.text: Do you know where he went?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Hehe, I hear that question a lot — seems like he owes everyone something. That's why he never discloses his whereabouts.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: When people need him, he appears, and when people really need him, he disappears. Sampo's first and second laws of motion.

children.text: I want to ask something else.

text: I want to ask about Wildfire...

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ...I'm a doctor, not an informant! Very well, what's the question?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Wildfire is a volunteer grassroots organization. Like I said, you can think of it as the Silvermane Guards of the underground.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: They've taken on the duties of the Guards: Maintain safety and order in the Underworld and compete with Fragmentum corrosion for living space.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Wherever there is hardship and a cry for help, there is Wildfire.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ...You can always find them.

children.text: I want to ask something else.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Okay, take care, and make sure you look after yourself.

text:
(After exiting the clinic, a cinematic view of Boulder Town plays before panning toMarch 7thwith a group of children)
(UnlockAchievementLost World)

title: Step Description
content: You find March 7th and discover her to be immersed in a children's game and doesn't notice you at all."Of course," you think. "When a companion is unconscious and the other missing, what better way to resolve it than to 'find a few kids to play games with'?"You've convinced yourself. Now it's the cute March 7th's turn to do the same.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...So you promise that if I win hide-and-seek, you'll tell big sister March all the ins and outs.

speaker: Hook
line: Yep! All the ins and outs, hehe! ...What does that mean?

speaker: March 7th
line: It just means you'll tell me all the details. No hiding anything, and no telling fibs.

speaker: Hook
line: Hmph, Hook isn't an overgrounder y'know! Hook never tells fibs!

speaker: Julian
line: Yeah, never!

speaker: March 7th
line: Well, that's settled then~ Okay, let's play... Huh?

speaker: March 7th
line: You... When did you get here?

speaker: March 7th
line: Uh... th—this isn't just hide-and-seek, okay? Let me explain...

speaker: March 7th
line: Uh... th—this isn't just hide-and-seek, okay? Let me explain...

speaker: March 7th
line: Quit acting like a child!

speaker: March 7th
line: It's like this: After I woke up, that doctor said Sampo had taken Dan Heng with him. I went around in circles trying to find the blue-haired scoundrel, and bumped into these kids. They say they know where he is!

speaker: March 7th
line: But they said I had to join " The Moles " or something if I wanted to find out... and to do that, I had to prove my strength by winning a game of hide-and-seek... do you get it?

text: I get it. Need a teammate?

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Huh. (Trailblazer), when did you start being so nice?

text: I get it. Well, best of luck.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), you just got here and now you're gonna leave? Play hide-and-seek with me!

text: I get it. You're being bullied by children.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ ...Ugh, so what if I am! (Trailblazer), why don't you help me, huh!?

speaker: Hook
line: Hey, are you done with your secret talk!? The Moles' time is precious!

speaker: Julian
line: Yeah, precious!

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Okay, okay, we're done. Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, this is my friend, (Trailblazer). ( He / She ) also wants to join The Moles. Can ( he / she ) play too?

speaker: Hook
line: Ummmm... sure. I guess so. Then... you guys are seeking!

speaker: Julian
line: ...Boss! They don't seem very smart. Why don't we do a practice one first?

speaker: Hook
line: Hmm... you're right Julian. Okay, let's do a practice one. I'll hide, you two have to find me!

speaker: March 7th
line: So you kids think you're better than us, huh? Just you wait and see!

text: Find the concealed kid to complete the practice

title: Step Description
content: March 7th attempts to convince you but you no longer care for it as much anymore, because the kids have started taunting you.You will not stand for this! It's time to show these children the cruelty of the grown-ups' world.Use your unrivaled and precise hiding skills to teach these kids a lesson!

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), it's simple. When you see one of them, you just have to catch them!

speaker: March 7th
line: Ha! Gotcha!

speaker: Hook
line: S—So what, it's just a practice! Wait until we're playing for real — you'll see!

speaker: March 7th
line: Hehe, bring it on!

speaker: Hook
line: Alright, now we're playing for real! You gotta count to fifty before you open your eyes — no cheating!

speaker: March 7th
line: Hehe~ Ready or not, here I come, naughty children...

text: Find all the hidden children and win (0/3)

title: Step Description
content: March 7th attempts to convince you but you no longer care for it as much anymore, because the kids have started taunting you.You will not stand for this! It's time to show these children the cruelty of the grown-ups' world.Little do they know that the practice just now was just a warm-up... The cruel and real Hide-and-seek is only about to begin!

speaker: Hook
line: The Moles haven't lost a game for ages! You're doomed!

speaker: Hook
line: You got it yet? We're the underground's greatest hiders and seekers!

text: (If the player attempts to leave the area)

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, where are you going?

speaker: March 7th
line: Come back, come back, they won't be hiding that far away!

speaker: March 7th
line: Don't run! I got you, Hook!

speaker: Hook
line: N—Not fair! I'm the boss of The Moles — how can I lose to a bunch of villains!

speaker: Hook
line: Do your worst! I'm not afraid.

speaker: March 7th
line: What are they feeding you kids down here...

text: (Upon finding and talking to Moles Sidekick)

speaker: March 7th
line: Haha, I caught you!

speaker: Cunning Child
line: Hmph, doesn't count unless you can answer this question.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wha—! But we caught you! What's with the Q&A?

speaker: Cunning Child
line: ...*sigh* I thought I had you there.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hmm... something's not right...

speaker: March 7th
line: That guy's been staring at us this whole time... Hide-and-seek might have to wait — let's see what he wants.

speaker: March 7th
line: My instincts are telling me something's not right with this guy, but...

children.speaker: Seemingly Adult Man
children.line: Nonsense! Ahem! How many eight-year-olds do you see walking around that look like this, huh?

children.speaker: Seemingly Adult Man
children.line: That's because I'm tall... and old! I'm a grown man! Ask anyone!

text: Looks like an adult to me...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...With a child's brain...?

children.speaker: Seemingly Adult Man
children.line: Well here's the truth: I'm a grown man!

speaker: March 7th
line: Alright, the jig is up, your voice gave it away...

speaker: Julian
line: ...Argh! But I'm Julian of a Thousand Faces! *sigh* Why did you have to talk to me! My reputation is ruined... What will the boss think!

speaker: March 7th
line: No need for the melodrama. That was still a magical performance...

speaker: Julian
line: I... *sigh* I'm sorry boss! I failed...

speaker: Hook
line: Darn! How did you see through Julian's disguise? What villainy is this?

speaker: March 7th
line: Hehehe... "Those with keen eyes see the dust between the stars!" I came up with that, by the way.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah, yeah, you're in the footnote somewhere~

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: About time I got some credit for it!

text: Doesn't sound like something you'd say...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey! I read books y'know!

speaker: March 7th
line: So, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, you can tell us now, right?

speaker: Hook
line: Ummmm... Yes. The boss of The Moles is true to her word!

speaker: Hook
line: Hook saw the blue-haired guy take your dark-haired friend to the Fight Club .

speaker: March 7th
line: The Fight Club?

text: I thought the first rule was...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...You don't talk about it...

children.speaker: Hook
children.line: Is this more secret talk?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: No kidding, they didn't exactly get off on the right foot.

speaker: March 7th
line: Uh, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, where is the Fight Club? Can you show us the way?

speaker: Hook
line: Hmm~ But it's an obvious building, grown-ups are just useless~

speaker: Hook
line: Come with Hook, I'll take you over.

speaker: March 7th
line: Thanks, o great one.

speaker: Hook
line: That's Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, to you! Who said you could shorten my title!?

text: Follow Hook to the Fight Club

title: Step Description
content: You've won and claimed victory in the game of hide-and-seek. You put on enough of a display of the rules of survival in the grown-ups' world to cause some emotional trauma for these kids.And now, the loser will have to fulfill her duty and guide the winner to the Fight Club to find Dan Heng.However, you still have no choice but to address this puny loser as the Pitch-Dark Hook the Great... You didn't take a liking to this.

speaker: March 7th
line: A club just for fighting... who knew undergrounders had such brutal hobbies.

speaker: Hook
line: Mm-hmm, in fact, it's awesome!

speaker: March 7th
line: They let YOU take part!? When did this place last have an inspection!

speaker: Hook
line: Loads of kids take part.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Despicable. My "criminal activity" senses are tingling.

text: (If the player moves away from Hook)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Agh, gotta stick close to Hook...

speaker: Hook
line: We're here! This is it.

speaker: Hook
line: Hook's gonna go fight. See ya later!

speaker: March 7th
line: Who's in charge here? How can they just let kids attack each other...?

speaker: Hook
line: The Moles are in charge, that's who! ...But only of the kids. Wildfire is in charge of grown-up business.

text: So The Moles control this whole area?

children.speaker: Hook
children.line: Umm, The Moles control everything underground!

text: How much do you know about Wildfire?

children.speaker: Hook
children.line: Umm, it's... The Moles for grown-ups...

speaker: Hook
line: Ooh! They need one more player there! I—I gotta go! If you ever wanna fight, come find me!
